name: Handover documents
PS1s, PS3s, PS4s, Certificate of compliance, engineers inspection reports, warranties and any other documents attached
Pre-commencement checklist
Checked Drawing No./ Revision
All equipment is calibrated and operating within tolerances
All materials checked & aligning with consented design & specifications prior to install - Consider timber treatment & fixing requirements
Installation carried-out by qualified workforce
Area accessible, substrate acceptable & approval to start works
Static line installation - Warm Roof

Line tensioner and indicator checked and acceptable. Attachment to end stanchion secured. Lock in pin cir-clip secured. Tension indicator disc can be rotated manually. Swaged cable termination secured, no evidence of slipping. There are 5 x Crimps per tensioner and end swage. All locknuts and fixings secured. No visible damage to unit/structure.
Anchorage cable installation checked and acceptable. No cuts or frays to cable. Cable correctly tensioned and not touching the roof deck. Securely attached to end stanchions. No visible damage.

System traveller checked and acceptable. Slide latch operates freely. Gap between tongue & shuttle inner casing when closed and latched with karabiner, 5mm maximum. Karabiner fits securely when slide latch closed. Karabiner gate lock device operates securely. No visible damage to unit.
Static line installation completed and acceptable
Intermediate/ Corner and End Plate Installation - Warm Roof
Template Name: Intermediate/ Corner and End Plate Installation - Warm Roof

name: Roof structure condition checked and acceptable. No rust or corrosion on roof, purlins or structure.
Positioning and installation of the plinth is correct and acceptable
Check roof substrade is acceptable and no visible damages.
Plate alignment is correct. Fixing holes to be aligned with fall of roof
2 toggles are to be installed and confirm toggles deployed fully at 90° to threaded bar.
Plate cover installed and acceptable.

Intermediate Plates: Dome screws and anchor plate screws fixed to structure. Steel/ timber: 14 gauge tek screw and minimum of 4 screw fixings per anchor (2 holes), sealant and Neoprene washer. End Plate and Corner Plate: Dome screws and anchor plate screws fixed to structure. Steel/ timber: 14 gauge tek screw and minimum of 10 screw fixings per anchor (2 holes), sealant and Neoprene washer. Sea spray zoning requires the screws to be stainless steel.
Attach static line components to static line plates - Tensioner, Shock Absorber and End Swage.
Install 8mm SS 7x7 cable to static line plates. Crimp the cable to the end of the static lines. 5 Crimps per end. Tension the static lines with the tensioner and tension indicator.
Plate ID label fixed on to plate with all information noted - Installer info, Limitations of use, Last certification date, Next recertification date and Rated for single person use (15kN)
Intermediate/ Corner and End Plate installation completed and acceptable
Anchor Point Installation
Roof structure condition checked and acceptable. No rust or corrosion on roof, purlins or structure.
Positioning and installation of the plinth is correct and acceptable
Check roof substrade is acceptable and no visible damages.
Anchor plate alignment is correct. Fixing holes to be aligned with fall of roof
2 toggles are to be installed and confirm toggles deployed fully at 90° to threaded bar.
Anchor plate cover installed and acceptable.

Dome screws and anchor plate screws fixed to structure. Steel/ timber: 14 gauge tek screw and minimum of 4 screw fixings per anchor (2 holes), sealant and Neoprene washer. Sea spray zoning requires the screws to be stainless steel
Anchor ID label fixed on to anchor plate with all information noted - Installer info, Limitations of use, Last certification date, Next recertification date and Rated for single person use (15kN)
Anchor point installation completed and acceptable
